intro: Landolphia mayottensis, commonly known as the Mayotte morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar and the Comoros. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms during the day. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in botanical gardens and ecological studies.
